Construction status: Land clearing begins for Building 1-5
Building 1-3 operational, based on default roof-to-operational time.

Building 4-5 operational, based on default roof-to-operational time. Land clearing begins for Building 11-20, and for Building 6-10 (assumed based on Building 11-12 being in similar state on 2021-03-16).
Building 6-10 operational, based on default roof-to-operational time for the last building. We assume they become operational at the same time due to the bridges between the buildings.

Building 11, 12, and 15 are operational. Based on default roof-to-operational time for the last building, and all components of the buildings looking complete. We assume the buildings become operational at the same time due to the bridges between the buildings.
New chiller configuration starts getting installed on Building 16-20.
Confirmation that Building 6-10 look complete, no visible construction on them.

Large substation is visibly connected to transmission lines. New chillers look fully installed on Building 16-18. Chillers have also been installed on Building 14, using the old design. Since power and cooling is apparently in place, we expect Building 14 and 16-18 are operational. Chillers are almost installed on Building 13, 19, 20, with construction equipment still around the building.
Expect Building 13, 19, and 20 have finished upgrading with new chillers.
Land clearing begins
Generators and chillers still being installed on buildings 1-5.
Buildings 1-5 are operational, based on roofs being completed 5 months ago and generators being installed by 2025-04-10.
Confirmation that five buildings are fully equipped with cooling and backup generators.

Buildings 1-12 are operational. The outline of buildings 1-5 was evident on 2024-05-19 and estimated to be operational 1 year later. Assuming the same timeline, buildings 6-12 should be complete by 2026-09-18. This also roughly aligns with [expected completion by 2027](https://www.datacenterdynamics.com/en/news/aws-confirmed-as-company-behind-10bn-mississippi-data-center-development/)
Land clearing begins
Roof complete on Buildings 3
Buildings 1-4 are operational. Buildings 1-2 had roofs as of 2025-09-21 are likely operational in 5 months, but buildings 3-4 appear about 3 months behind them, suggesting an 8-month total duration.

Buildings 1-14 operational. Buildings 1-4 will likely take over 2 years on this site. By comparison, Buildings 1-7 at the New Carlisle site were completed in less than 1.5 years. Assuming a similar pace, we expect 10 additional buildings to take about 2 years after 2025-09-21. This aligns with [expected completion by 2027](https://www.datacenterdynamics.com/en/news/aws-confirmed-as-company-behind-10bn-mississippi-data-center-development/) and a [permit review document](https://opc.deq.state.ms.us/get_doc.aspx?dt=eparat&id=1747289) from 2025-06-25 for this site, stating the project will take “years” to build.

Data center: Anthropic-Amazon Project Rainier New Carlisle Indiana
Construction status: Land clearing begins in the northern section

Data center: Anthropic-Amazon Project Rainier New Carlisle Indiana
Construction status: Land clearing begins in the southern section

Data center: Anthropic-Amazon Project Rainier New Carlisle Indiana
Construction status: Roof complete on building 11

Data center: Anthropic-Amazon Project Rainier New Carlisle Indiana
Construction status: Buildings 1-7 are operational. Based on all of the roofs being completed for over 5 months.

Data center: Anthropic-Amazon Project Rainier New Carlisle Indiana
Construction status: Roof complete on building 16. Generators are being installed for buildings 8-15. In the north, Building 17 and 18 are under construction. To the south of buildings 8-16, a concrete pad is visible, and an expanded car park next to it.

Data center: Anthropic-Amazon Project Rainier New Carlisle Indiana
Construction status: Confirmation that nearly 500,000 chips are operational, which fits buildings 1-7. In an [interview](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jwgW_gHI1Vs&t=220s), AWS CEO says "they're already running...about 500,000 [Trainium2] chips in Indiana today".

Data center: Anthropic-Amazon Project Rainier New Carlisle Indiana
Construction status: Buildings 8-11 are operational, given it's been over 6 months since their roofs were complete. This also smoothly interpolates between 500k chips in October and 1M chips by January - points that are based on an [interview](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jwgW_gHI1Vs&t=220s) with the AWS CEO.

Data center: Anthropic-Amazon Project Rainier New Carlisle Indiana
Construction status: Buildings 12-16 are operational. Expect the roof to be complete for Buildings 17-18, based on Building 7 taking about 4 months to go from starting construction to roof complete.

Data center: Anthropic-Amazon Project Rainier New Carlisle Indiana
Construction status: Buildings 17-18 are operational. This is an estimate based on a rule of thumb of "operational 5 months after roof is complete".

The former [crypto mining](https://investor.galaxy.com/news/news-details/2025/Galaxy-Announces-Commitment-with-CoreWeave-to-Host-Additional-Artificial-Intelligence-and-High-Performance-Computing-Infrastructure-at-Helios-Data-Center-Campus/default.aspx) Helios site begins expanding, with land cleared for additional buildings.
Backup generator pads and steel framing for chillers are visible, similar to the [3D renderings](https://www.galaxy.com/data-centers).

Building 1 operational at full capacity. This corresponds to "Phase I", which is [expected](https://investor.galaxy.com/news/news-details/2025/Galaxy-Announces-Third-Quarter-2025-Financial-Results/default.aspx) to be operational by the end of the first half of 2026.

Building 2 and 3 are operational at full capacity. This corresponds to "Phase II", which is [expected](https://investor.galaxy.com/news/news-details/2025/Galaxy-Announces-Third-Quarter-2025-Financial-Results/default.aspx) to be delivered "throughout 2027". We assume it takes until the end of 2027 to reach full capacity. Since Phase II adds roughly double the power of Building 1, we also assume there are two buildings added.

Building 4 operational at full capacity. This corresponds to "Phase III", which is [expected](https://investor.galaxy.com/news/news-details/2025/Galaxy-Announces-Third-Quarter-2025-Financial-Results/default.aspx) to be delivered "starting in 2028". We assume it takes until the end of 2028 to reach full capacity.
Land clearing begins
Building 1 and 2 under construction.

Building 1 operational. First two buildings are [expected to complete construction by Spring 2026](https://web.archive.org/web/20250923144616/https://www.facebook.com/plugins/post.php?href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Farmdems%2Fposts%2Fupdate-on-lima-road-and-the-data-center-from-armstrong-county-democratic-chair-s%2F122148303506797709%2F). We use the midpoint of Spring (2026-04-15) as a best guess for completion. But this is when the buildings are "turned over to the tenant", so it might take more time to install the IT equipment - we think about 2 months. So we estimate 2026-06-15. This [regulatory document](https://www.tdlr.texas.gov/TABS/Search/Project/TABS2025027064) lists the completion date for Building 1 as 2026-09-12 but this is probably conservative.

Building 2 operational. The completion date for [Building 2 Tenant Improvement](https://www.tdlr.texas.gov/TABS/Search/Project/TABS2025027065) is 2026-11-07, about 2 months later than Building 1. We therefore add 2 months to the Building 1 operational date.

7 buildings operational. Based on (1) a project deadline of EOY 2027 in the [tax abatement doc](https://www.co.armstrong.tx.us/upload/page/5361/Phase%201%20Tax%20Abatement%20Agreement%20-%20Signed.pdf), which seems conservative and (2) the similar 8-building project in Abilene taking an estimated 2 years and 2 months.
Land clearing begins.

Building 1 and 2 are operational. According to [Google's report on their data center efficiency](https://datacenters.google/efficiency/), this data center did not have 12 months of PUE data until 4Q2022. This suggests Building 1 was not operational until 3Q2021. 5 more cooling units were added since March 2020, and roofs and generators have been present for both buildings for many months.
First part of Building 3 is operational.
Building 3 extension is operational, based on ~5 months since roof being completed, and additional cooling units being installed sometime within that period. Building 4 roof complete.

Building 4 operational. This is in between when 6 cooling units were visible as of 2024-04-20, and when the final 7th unit appeared as of 2024-09-13. It's also about 5 months after the roof was complete. Building 5 roof also complete.
Building 5 and 6 operational, based on all cooling units and tanks installed.
Work is underway on Building 7. Some walls and a few backup generators are in place.
Building 7 roof is half complete. About half of the backup generators are in place. One cooling tower is partly built.

Building 7 is operational. The roof of building 6 was partially complete as of 2024-07-27, and estimated to be operational as of 2025-03-09. Building 7 roof was partially complete as of 2025-09-02, so assuming the same timeline, it will be operational by 2026-04-01.
Land clearing begins.
Building 1 operational, based on it being 6 months after roof was complete, infrastructure looked complete for 5 months.
Building 2 has 3 cooling towers installed.
Building 2 is operational, based on it being 8 months since the roof was complete, and surrounding infrastructure looks just completed (finishing the cooling towers).
Confirmation that there's no obvious construction happening for Building 2. Building 3 roof started.
Confident that Building 2 is operational

Building 3 has all backup generators in place but they are still being installed. Two cooling towers have fans on them, with more underway. To the south of Building 3, more land has been cleared and there's a new carpark. This suggests another building will soon start construction.
Building 3 is operational. Based on building 2 time from foundation to completion.
Building 4 is operational. Expect a 4th building because there's enough land cleared for it. Assuming there's a foundation soon after 2025-09-25 and it takes a similar time to building 2.
Building 5 is operational. We expect a 5th building because there's enough land cleared for one. We assume a roughly 6-month delay between building operation, based on previous building estimates.
Land clearing begins

Foundations are underway for the main buildings, and the overall layout aligns with the [architectural renderings](https://engineering.fb.com/2025/09/29/data-infrastructure/metas-infrastructure-evolution-and-the-advent-of-ai/) published in 2025.

New [power stations](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1D4eUHwEuirNi0g3IU_xGOti3PcC8fcXi/view?usp=sharing) are in service for a 1.8 GW load at Holly Ridge. However, the data center is still not operational.

First phase is operational, based on a [Meta blog post](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1PmFNgOwkPepwjpGIbNUuPJP0LNgIqe7l/view?usp=sharing). We assume that this aligns with the three natural gas turbines being completed, for a total of 2262 MW capacity, but that these turbines have a backup role. This is close to the 1800 MW of load requested from the grid. Meta [claims](https://engineering.fb.com/2025/09/29/data-infrastructure/metas-infrastructure-evolution-and-the-advent-of-ai/) that "The Hyperion cluster will have a 5-gigawatt capacity once complete", but so far there is no concrete evidence for this happening at the Holly Ridge site alone.
Land clearing begins for Building 1-3
Building 1 operational. Based on our default estimate of roof-to-operational time.
Building 2 operational. Based on our default estimate of roof-to-operational time.
Building 3 operational. Based on our default estimate of roof-to-operational time.
Building 4 operational. Based on our default estimate of roof-to-operational time.
Roof complete on Building 8. In the northernmost area, land clearing begins on a new Meta site for Building 19-23
Building 5 and 6 operational. Based on our default estimate of roof-to-operational time, and completion of cooling infrastructure.
Building 7 (QTS) operational. Based on our default estimate of roof-to-operational time.
Building 19 (Meta tent) roof is complete. The on-site power at Socrates South and Socrates North has some outlines of gas turbines, to be installed later.
Building 8 (QTS) operational. Based on our default estimate of roof-to-operational time.
Building 9 (QTS) operational. Based on our default estimate of roof-to-operational time.
Building 10-15 (Meta tents) operational. Based on our default estimate of roof-to-operational time.
Building 16 (Vantage) [operational](https://vantage-dc.com/data-center-locations/north-america/new-albany-ohio)
Building 17 (Vantage) operational, based on it starting construction about 3 months after Building 1.
Building 18 (Vantage) operational, based on it starting construction about 3 months after building 2.

Socrates South and Socrates North gas power plants are operational, coinciding with Building 19-23 being operational. Based [on](https://dis.puc.state.oh.us/CaseRecord.aspx?CaseNo=25-0188-EL-BGN) [documents](https://dis.puc.state.oh.us/ViewImage.aspx?CMID=A1001001A25E29B42006E01696) [stating](https://www.williams.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/8/2025/03/Socrates-North-Fact-Sheet-Final-1.pdf) "late Third or early Fourth Quarter of 2026", "late 2026", "November 2026", "third quarter of 2026". We assume Socrates North will have 5 tents next to it like Socrates South does.
Land clearing begins for southern part (Building 1-2)
Building 1 operational, based on it being 6 months since the roof was completed. Mechanical equipment still being installed outside Building 2.
Building 2 operational, based on chillers being fully installed, and more than 6 months since the roof was completed. Roof of northwestern building completed.
Building 3 operational. Roof of Building 4 is partly installed.
Roof of Building 4 is almost complete, mechanical equipment is still being installed.
Expect Building 4 building to be operational. This is faster than Building 2, but based on our high-res satellite image, there was more parallel progress on the chillers for the northern building.
Land clearing begins for Building 1.

Building 1 cooling and backup generators all look complete from above but there is still construction visible around the building. Building 2 is well underway with a foundation and a complete substation. Large carpark and concrete area north of Building 2. Building 3 has a concrete foundation and a substation underway.

Building 1 operational. Latest [prediction](https://blogs.microsoft.com/on-the-issues/2025/09/18/made-in-wisconsin-the-worlds-most-powerful-ai-datacenter/) from Microsoft is "early 2026" so we conservatively assume end of March.

Building 2 operational. This is based on (1) the delay between Building 1 and Building 2 starting land clearing, (2) in March 2025, a Microsoft spokesperson [said](https://www.wpr.org/news/microsoft-pauses-construction-on-parts-of-mount-pleasant-site-again) “fully on track” with the first phase , where “southern datacenter buildings complete, and preparation begins for operations” was [expected](https://local.microsoft.com/blog/mount-pleasant-datacenter-project-update/) by late 2026. Finally, while it's not 100% consistent with our estimates, MISO was [planning](https://cdn.misoenergy.org/NEW%20LOAD%20ANNOUNCEMENTS%20IN%20MISO%20REGIONS%2012062024684954.pdf) 1480 MW of load for Microsoft in Mount Pleasant in 2026.

Building 3 operational. Based on how long Building 1 took from land clearing to operation. Power and compute capacity is uncertain, as it is based on the relative sizing of the buildings and mechanical areas in architectural drawings (see [calculation](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/10bfo173cjvehaMqextiRGc95lBdPmtZbLDyNvbEN0N0/edit?gid=0#gid=0&range=B40)).

Building 4 operational. Based on how long Building 1 took from land clearing to operation. Power and compute capacity is uncertain, as it is based on the relative sizing of the buildings and mechanical areas in architectural drawings (see [calculation](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/10bfo173cjvehaMqextiRGc95lBdPmtZbLDyNvbEN0N0/edit?gid=0#gid=0&range=B40)).
Land clearing begins for northern two buildings (Building 1-2)

Building 1 operational. It looks complete including chillers, and it's been 7 months since the roof looked complete. The "tenant improvement" work [is not due](https://www.tdlr.texas.gov/TABS/Search/Project/TABS2025000156) until September, but that due date might be conservative for regulatory purposes.

Building 1 and 2 fully operational, given the chillers look completely installed, the 200 MW substation built in 2022 is available, plus 5x 34-38 MW natural gas turbines looking complete. This is consistent with [Crusoe's impact report](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/6855c1aa175582ee23e0aa19/68710273a71bb7c11049ba28_Crusoe_Impact_Report_2024.pdf#page=19) from June 2025 saying that 206 MW is expected to be energized in 2025 (unclear if IT power or total facility power, but this normally means IT power). 5 more turbines still under construction. Chillers partly installed for Building 3. Roof complete for Building 4. Larger 1 GW substation not complete yet.
Building 3 and 4 operational, based on Building 4 construction [end date](https://www.tdlr.texas.gov/TABS/Search/Project/TABS2025014756).

Building 5-8 operational, based on the latest construction end date ([Building 8](https://www.tdlr.texas.gov/TABS/Search/Project/TABS2025019022)), [news](https://www.enr.com/articles/61133-project-team-pushes-limits-on-abilene-data-center-job).
Building 9-10 operational. This date is estimated by comparing the timing of Building 9-10 to the timing of previous buildings.
Land clearing begins for Building 1 and 2
Building 1 and 2 are partly constructed. No clear evidence of more data center buildings starting construction.

Building 1 and 2 are operational. The similar data center in Ajman, UAE was delayed by over a year, now due in December 2026 (compare [1](https://khaznadatacenters.com/press-release/khazna-expands-infrastructure-to-accelerate-uaes-leadership-in-artificial-intelligence/), [2](https://khaznadatacenters.com/press-release/khazna-announces-the-uaes-first-ai-optimized-data-center-and-the-largest-in-its-portfolio-powering-the-nations-drive-toward-ai-leadership/)). The buildings here looked 3-6 months behind the Ajman building as of November 2025, but they were moving faster. So we think Building 1 and 2 are on track for 200 MW by December 2026.

1 GW of IT power is operational. We haven’t seen expansion beyond 200 MW as of November 2025. Optimistically, 8 more 100 MW buildings start construction in December 2025, in parallel, and take 1.5 years like the first two buildings, hitting 1 GW by Q3 2027. More realistically, there's some staggering of construction over several months, like Stargate Abilene. Our median estimate is January 2028.
Construction starts with a road added on site, retrofitting a former Electrolux building.
First [significant/useful training workload](https://x.ai/colossus) on 25k H100s.
[100k H100s online](https://archive.is/z39uN).
150k H100s and 50k H200s online. This is roughly when Musk [said](https://archive.is/z39uN), plus on this date they [reported]((https://x.ai/colossus)) "running jobs with 150K+ GPUs".
Second substation almost connected (red cables)
[30k B200s added](https://archive.is/oHQSA) (in GB200 configuration).

Third substation looks completed, but it doesn't appear to be connected to the building yet. Some air-cooled chillers removed, while large cooling towers are added. Many of the gas turbines were also removed, and this doesn't seem to be made up for by grid power yet. Based on that, power capacity decreased slightly.
There is still construction visible in the third substation yard and next to the new cooling towers.

Third substation was [expected](https://www.mlgw.com/images/content/files/pdf/new/5-5-25%20xAI%20Update.pdf) to power the building in "Fall", so we date this in the middle of Fall. We expect the 12 generators from 2025-09-17 are still present and in use.
Land clearing begins next to the existing building.

Battery facility connected to the building. 121 air-cooled chillers installed, which could support 200 MW. In the Duke faciltiy in nearby Mississippi, several natural gas turbines are in place but not fully connected up.

Battery facility looks complete (though more might be added). Turbines look connected up, minimal construction around them. Based on this, and on [earlier](https://x.com/elonmusk/status/1947715674429919279) [tweets](https://x.com/elonmusk/status/1950251710141567110) from Elon Musk, 110,000 NVIDIA GB200 GPUs are operational.

The facility is at the full ~1 gigawatt, 550,000 GPU capacity that was planned as of mid-2025. The timing is based on the later end of Musk's [prediction](https://www.cnbc.com/2025/05/20/cnbc-transcript-elon-musk-sits-down-for-secondary-interview-with-cnbcs-david-faber-live-on-cnbc-today-.html) of 9 months after May 2025.
